intro: Ecbolium nilgherrense, commonly known as the Nilgiri ecbolium, is a rare shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high elevations. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a threatened species.
